待我换上 [strike]远古时空减缓机[/strike] 再战,看我不打烂你的狗头.
[spoiler]又称低配过时辣鸡电脑[/spoiler]


来说说游戏吧,游戏是快速反映闪避迅速往你脸上撞的长方形.

因为是长方形,而且只要碰到不该碰的东西就瞬间爆炸,完成升天.
而且你需要按住键位才能保持所在位置,所以[b]经常会因为松手太快而导致主动撞脸.[/b]

最主要的是不停晃动的画面,即便有一道线来提醒还是会是一不小心按错,然后看着自己浑身炸裂.
[u]配合带感的BGM,真是锻炼自己反映和判断的好休闲游戏啊![/u]

31762102.review:
날아오는 검은 블럭을 정해진 9칸 내에서 피해야 하는 게임 [b]《리플렉스》[/b]다. 일단 기본적인 속도가 빠른 편이며, 시간이 60초에 가까워질수록 점점 더 빨라지기 때문에 집중하지 않으면 60초 찍기가 정말 정말 정말 힘든 게임이다.

 + 모드가 총 5가지 준비되어 있다(당연히 방식은 같음)
 + 나름 듣기 괜찮은 BGM
 + 빠른 속도감으로 지루함이 덜 하다
 + 드렁큰 난이도가 존재(기존에서 화면 일렁거림 + 키 조작 반대가 추가된다)
 
 - 도전과제 올클리어가 생각 보다 힘들다
 - 가격이 시.발 너무 비싼 것 같다

이런 게임할 때 마다 눈의 피로가 극에 달한다. 한 번 죽을 때 마다 눈을 세게 감고 뜨는 걸 반복해서 피로를 풀어주도록 하자. 그리고 해보면 알겠지만 박스들이 날아오기 전에 먼저 검은색 라인이 쫙 생긴다. 그 라인을 보고 피하는 게 정말 훨씬 훨씬 더 쉬우니 참고하도록 하자 '-' ★

28982538.review:
I picked up this game on sale as filler to reach the $5 mark when making another purchase. It piqued my interest, being Super Hexagon-esque, but wasn't sure what to expect. What I got was a well crafted game with fast and smooth animations, snappy response, decent music, and (most importantly for this type of game) the ability to retry nearly instantly. I have a few nitpicks here and there, but ended up enjoying this game better than the other one I bought. Overall, a very enjoyable near-sighted bullet dodging simulator.

[i]I will be making many comparisons to Super Hexagon, as that's the closest game to this style that does so much right.[/i]

[h1]Full Review[/h1]
[b]Controls[/b]
It uses six buttons, escape, spacebar and arrowkeys/WASD, can't get much easier than that. Hitting one is satisfying, as your pentagon responds quickly and nearly instantly. What's also neat, is this game supports controller. Pretty standard, left stick to move, A and B to navigate menus. But this leads into one of my qualms. Only the left stick can be used for navigation, not the right. I would have preferred being able to use my dominant hand for movement. Another aspect about controller is that it's easy to accidentally move to a corner rather than straight to the side, leading to an untimely restart. That comes across as more of a limitation of a controller interface, and of course, can be avoided if you use keyboard. I have a gripe about the keyboard as well, though. If using the standard three fingers on the movement keys, you will need to have one of those jump between keys, most probably UP and DOWN. That action makes it easy to slip up in those directions. Normally I wouldn't remotely consider this an issue, but since this game relies on millisecond precision, something as benign as jumping between rows can slip you up. It comes across as a bit of an imbalance, rather than intentional difficulty jump, as LEFT and RIGHT won't suffer from that.

[b]Music[/b]
Genre and selection is, in my opinion, perfect for this game. Fast-paced, electronic with some elements of chiptune, keep the blood pumping and usually go nicely with the difficulty. It looks like three different artists contributed music, Adhenoid, ForeverBound, and RollingFacade. The game starts out strong with a fantastic track. [i]Reignite[/i] by ForeverBound instantly became my favorite track in the game, followed by Adhenoid's [i]Machinarium[/i] and [i]Stepping into Madness[/i]. RollingFacade contributed two tracks, but I didn't like either one. [i]Laser Dragon[/i] works in the game, but I didn't find it to be anything exceptional. That's fine, I don't expect to like every track in a game. [i]Handicapped[/i] is the oddball out. It's tempo is noticeably slower than all the others, and that might make sense if it were for the easiest difficulty, but it comes with the next step up. Slower tempo, mixed with continually faster speed, doesn't make for a good accompaniment.

[b]Gameplay[/b]
RFLEX plays very similarly to Super Hexagon, as it's the same same vein of game. Start, dodge, restart. Good choice of clean and clear styling with no antialiasing or upscaling issues. The objects are either drawn vectors or very high resolution images. It has stylized scan lines and screen curvature, which you can even change the intensity of, like a CRT monitor. Nice bit of character to differentiate it from other similar styles. Everything is golden in the graphics department. 

As for difficulty and progression, my experience has been good. The way each level seems to progress is that it starts slow and incrementally gets faster and faster until (I presume) it's humanly impossible to keep up, as opposed to Super Hexagon which seems to go a static speed for each minute. This means that it will get incredibly difficult to go for distance. My (current) personal best on the easiest difficulty for RFLEX is 88 seconds compared to around 5 minutes on Super Hexagon. At this time, the record for the easiest on RFLEX is about 170 seconds, so don't expect to be able to sit for a long (3+ minutes) single round. Transitions between levels goes pretty well, however something seems a little off with the last two. I find the second hardest difficulty to be the hardest. I've been able to get consistently further on the hardest than the preceeding difficulty. I don't know if this is frequent for others, but it's certainly not what seems to be intended.

This being said, difficulty between levels increases mostly fine. With each level, the blocks for each sequence are thrown from a variety of more directions and employ some other tricks to try to get you to slip up. There are some sneaky visual tricks up its sleeve, but lose potency with exposure, as any trick does. Also similar to Super Hexagon, is how the game handles each sequence of blocks. It picks from a random set of predetermined layouts and throws it at you from an arbitrary direction. This means that over time it's possible to memorize the sequence, basically guaranteeing that if you make it past the leading block, you'll make it past the remaining.

[b]Conclusion[/b]
RFLEX presents a highly enjoyable experience in the same vein as Super Hexagon. It's a fast paced, retro styled, dodging game that's easily picked up, difficult to master, and lets you retry milliseconds after you inevitably fail. It has a few flaws, but gets the core gameplay completely right, making this game a great experience.

28463913.review:
If you enjoy reflex heavy games such as Super Hexagon, the game is cheap enough that you should definitly try it.  The one thing that such people should be aware of is that this game is not nearly as 'tight' as Super Hexagon; the game recommends a controller, but does not support the d-pad, only the joystick.  As someone who is not precise with a joystick I had what felt like [i]too[/i] much control, I prefered to use the keyboard.
All in all it's a fun time-waster, but only for a limited audience.

28343680.review:
あんなにやることが少ない、ただただ失敗とリトライを繰り返すだけのSuper Hexagonがなぜ優れたゲームであったのか。
それは「身体的な反射神経」と「思考的な反射神経」を同時に、複合的に求められるゲームであったからだ。
迫り来る障害物を見てどのパターンであるかを判断し、それに対してどのように動けば避けられるのかを考え、実際に避ける。
この一連の反射をどれだけ素早く正確に行うことができるかを競うゲームだったからだ。
ゲームとはなにかを突き詰めていったとき、たどり着く答えのひとつがこの「身体的・思考的反射神経」を問われ、それが足りない時にいかにトライ＆エラーで乗り越えていくか、というものではないだろうか。
それをプリミティブなビジュアルで極限まで単純化したからこそ、誰もが瞬時にハマれる優れたゲームだったのだと考える。

本作RFLEXもまさにそういったゲームであり、ならば必然的に優れたゲームである。
ただし、操作レスポンスにおいて若干の癖があるのでそのつもりで。

23072870.review:
BugZy's Review: RFLEX - Geometry warfare!

The following is my opinion.

Enter the arcade world of RFLEX, where the only thing that will save your pentagonal character from ultimately colliding with what seem to be big black rectangles are the swift reflexes that you hope and pray to possess upon launching the game. Without them, you won’t last 10 seconds.

The game consists of a few basic elements, they are ‘dodge things,’ ‘don’t let things hit you’ and ‘move damn it, that thing is going to utterly destroy you.’ You use the arrow keys or a gamepad to move your pentagon out of the way of your lifeless enemies before they reach the end of their path, ending the round if they hit you.

When I started playing the game my first natural assumption was that the projectiles flew at my shape in a random order, but a few minutes in I realised that that was clearly not the case. There are patterns that you can predict in order to stand a chance at dodging your impending doom. It’s handy to know and has saved me several hundred times.

As you may predict based on what I have stated previously, the game is astonishingly challenging. After watching the trailer and maybe a few videos of gameplay, you may think ‘this looks pretty easy,’ but let me tell you, the game is a lot harder than it looks. There are five levels in RFLEX, they are Amusement, Challenge, Addiction, Lifestyle and Death Wish (the name scares me,) each with their own quirks and patterns and all very, very difficult.

If you would like to let everyone know you are amazing or are happy with telling the world you are terrible at the game, there are both global and friend leaderboards. Brag away!

The graphics are simple, just black on certain colours depending on what mode you have picked. Simple doesn’t mean bad though. Having the same colours every match makes it easy on the eyes as they aren’t constantly changing like in Super Hexagon (where you need the special glasses to prevent brain destroying migraines.)

You play the game to an awesome electronic soundtrack featuring ForeverBound, Valiant and RollingFacade. Oh and I couldn’t resist to mention that there is a drunk mode. It’s pretty self-explanatory and is a perfect simulation of being drunk whilst playing RFLEX.

Wesley is such a great guy that he has also added an epileptic friendly mode for those of you who suffer from photosensitive epilepsy and has stated that ‘if you are not satisfied with this option, and are unable to play this game, you are entitled to a refund.’

All in all, RFLEX is a great arcade game of dodge and if you have time to kill and a few dollars to spare, you should definitely check it out.

RFLEX has earned 9/10 wallabies.

21199677.review:
A ideia de RFLEX é simples. Você deverá controlar o seu objeto, por meio de nove pontos, enquanto outros objetos os atravessando vindo das mais variadas direções, em padrões aleatórios e de forma rápida.

Eu não poderia recomendar mais este jogo. Ao mesmo tempo em que, como um jogador de jogos competitivos, também gosto de jogos casuais, RFLEX atinge essas minhas duas necessidades na busca de um jogo divertido para matar o tempo e melhorar minhas habilidades.

Para meu eu-competitivo, RFLEX me ajuda não apenas a testar, mas melhorar minhas habilidades de jogos competitivos como: 1) Reflexos; 2) Tempo de reação; e 3) Coordenação entre olhos e mão.

Para meu eu-casual, é um jogo divertido de plataforma, com design bonito e arte monocromática, e uma trilha sonora frenética e que se encaixa perfeitamente ao gameplay.

Outra coisa importante que eu amo sobre RFLEX é que te deixa usar o movimento das teclas "WSAD", para um jogador competitivo isso é muito importante. O jogo é bastante divertido e difícil, lembra clássicos modernos como Velocibox e Super Hexagon, e você se divertirá bastante jogando.

[b][h1]Prós:[/h1][/b]
- Gameplay fluido
- Linda arte
- Bons efeitos sonoros
- Bastante difícil e desafiador

[b][h1]Contras:[/h1][/b]
- Poucos modos

[b][h1]Nota final:[/h1][/b] 9/10

21199245.review:
게임 자체는 한손을 주머니에 넣고 플레이해도 되는 게임이지만
그런 안일한 정신으론 첫 스테이지도 못깰것이다.

슈퍼헥사곤과 비슷한 장르에 느낌까지 풍기지만
슈퍼헥사곤에 비해 속도감은 낮으며 요하는 반응속도는 굉장히 높다.
브금에 중독성은 없지만 오래 들어도 질리지 않을 정도는 되며
이 게임은 그리 번쩍번쩍거리지 않아서 눈이 아프지는 않았다.
(근데 집중력을 상당히 요구하기때문에 뚫어지게 계속 보다가 눈을 안감아서 아프다.)

이쪽 장르의 게임으로 가장 유명한 게임이 슈퍼헥사곤이라
슈퍼헥사곤이랑 비교하게 되는건 어쩔수 없는건진 모르겠지만
나름의 장점도 있고 할만한 게임.

자신의 집중력과 반응속도가 자신있다면 도전할만한 게임.

20616630.review: RFLEX utilizes simple mechanics coupled with difficult reaction based game play to challenge you and slowly rework your mind into being able to focus and process the obsticales it throws at you. A great game to sit down and play for a few minutes each day.

20585348.review:
Don't let the amount of time I've played this fool you. It's too hard.
RFLEX feels like [kind of] you are playing a mix of an old arcade game and a game you play now on your PC.
The game is simple: dodge the incoming obstatcles. However, I must say, the game is a lot deeper than that. At first look, you might think, "Oh, I can beat this within an hour." Probably not. Watch the video, it seems easy. It's insane with the classic and innovative joystick controls, along with the nice simple graphics that are quite amazing and arcade-game-based. 

If you like to rage, buy this game.
10/10 would rage quit again.

20570371.review:
RFLEX is a great game that challenges, and tests your "RFLEX"s, this game is also a lot harder than most people make it out to be, as one wrong move could screw you over. 
 
The game has a massive replayability due to it's 2 modes, Normal Mode and Drunk Mode (Ctrl), the feature to get high on the leaderboards, and how addicting it is. While playing, you can detect patterns, each level have their own set of patterns, if you want to get the high times, you need to know what these patterens are.
 
It's simplicity is done in a way to where it's is addicting and doesn't bore the players, but it also doesn't make it too complex and put off players. The simplicity then carries forward to it's achievements as they are quite straight forward to achieve them. 

Even though my time may be small, I recommend this game to anyone who likes a challenge, and has a hour or less to loose.

20398861.review: It`s pretty hard to play and it`s so expensive, i will not recommend this game to my friends.

20384546.review:
DISCLAIMER: WAS PROVIDED A FREE KEY BY THE DEVELOPER

The above however has zero influence on my following review.

RFLEX is a spiritual successor to Super Hexagon, utilizing the same style of 2D twitch reflex mechanics to dodge obstacles for a nearly impossible 60 seconds. However, I felt while playing this game that it had on edge on Super Hexagon due to more random obstacles than the same 7 memorizable patterns. Lets head to the pros and cons.

Pros: 
Amazing sound design, with a unique song for each level, made by brilliant electronic composers.

Simple yet deceivingly difficult gameplay that successfully fulfills the neo-arcade design, complete with customizable screen curving!

Minimalist graphics that focus back on to the gameplay rather than distracting you.

Extra modes that affect the regular levels for more fun!

Cons:
Controls were a teensy bit weird to understand at the start. Instead of permanent twitch moves you use the arrow keys to hold the hexagon in place and then release to bring it back to the center. Ultimately not a problem but it takes time to get used to. Would love to see an extra mode without it though ;)

Overall, RFLEX is a really fun and addicting twitch-reflex-neo-arcade-minimalist-psychedelic experience. Like Super Hexagon I will spend quite a bit of time getting used to the controls and tricks required to survive. Have fun!

19519457.review: This is a greate game but it's a little too hard and there should be an option to lock the screen so it doesnt rotate in game because that really throws me off. The music in this game is so good i love it! Keep up the good work.

19462082.review:
My friend told me, that this game can't be *that* hard, if you see the lines where the obstacles will flow. I knew it will be much harder that it seems to be. Anyway, it took me over 600 attemps until I finished third level. I don't know why, but I simply couldn't beat it. The feel when you finally beat the level is awesome, though. Also, your heart wants to break out of your chest, don't let it! ;)
If you like simple but hard games like this one, don't hesitate and buy it. Totally worths it.
When you're tired and annoyed, because you can't get over 60 seconds, take a break for a few minutes. I had troubles from the beginning too, but as of now, I'm in the first places in the leaderboards and still keep playing next levels.

+ simple graphics, catchy colors
+ easy to play, hard to master
+ 5+5 levels (it's enough, trust me)

+/- decent music (does not impress, but it's not bad either; I mostly play with custom music)
+/- I couldn't get used to the controls (maybe it was my bad habit from other rage games)

- nothing

And look for patterns. They're there, you just won't see them right away. They will help you pretty much.

8/10


UPDATE: I beat the game today (13. 12. 2016), incredible feeling of satisfaction. It took me about 11 hours of actual playing time. Well, now is the time to edit my achievement showcase, I guess.
It started as fun.. almost *passed out* in the end. ;)
Go play it! Go!

19094895.review:
이 게임은 겉으로만 보아서는 슈퍼 헥사곤과 비슷해 보이는 괜찮은 게임이다. 
그러나 직접 플레이 해보니, 블럭이 화면의 바깥에서 나오지 않고 중간에서 나오기 때문에 
요구되는 반응속도가 생각보다 상당히 짧은 편이다. 그러다보니 첫번째 맵부터 난이도가 상당하다. (쓸데없이)
따라서 초보자의 진입장벽이 매우 높으며, 슈퍼 헥사곤으로 자신만만하던 사람들도 곤욕을 치를 수 있다.

그리고 어떤 난이도든지 처음 시작할 때의 스피드가 같고 이후 서서히 빨라지는 식으로 진행되기 때문에 
높은 난이도의 맵을 플레이할 때 지루함을 느낄 수 있다. 
또한, 앞에서 말했듯이 블럭이 중간에서부터 나오는 것 때문에 
패턴을 외워도 빠른 반응속도를 내지 못해 반복적으로 죽는 경우가 생긴다.
이 때 굉장한 지루함을 느낀다. 
헥사곤의 경우 적절하게 요구되는 반응속도와 판단력이 잘 배합되어서, 
패턴이 반복되어도 피하는 조작 자체가 큰 즐거움이었는데 말이다.

또한 헥사곤의 그 특유의 신나는 브금을 조금은 기대했었는데, 
이 게임은 전혀 그렇지 않다.
내가 기억하기로(지금은 환불했다)
위에 있는 소개영상에 나오는 브금은 5개의 난이도맵중 4번째의 맵에 해당하며, 
예외적으로 첫번째 맵의 브금은 들어줄 만하다.
(첫번째 맵의 브금은 geometry dash의 첫번째 맵 브금을 작곡한 것으로 유명한 Forever Bound 님이 만든 것이다)
나머지 3개의 맵의 브금은 들을만한게 못된다.(고 생각한다.)
브금이 전혀 신명나지 않고 우울하며, 금방 질려버린다. 
4번째 난이도맵의 브금도 마찬가지이다.
그래픽 마저도 단색 배경
(색 변화가 매우 미미하다) 
+ 검은색 캐릭터와 검은색 장애물 때문에 별로 즐거운 느낌이 없다. 
답답하고 짜증이 난다.(이것은 나의 주관적인 생각일 뿐이며, 
별로 그럴 것 같지 않다고 생각한다면 위의 공식 스샷을 보고 
저 느낌의 색감으로 몇시간이고 게임을 한다고 상상해보라.)

솔직히 말해서 이 게임의 컨트롤 방식도 마음에 들지 않지만, 
그렇게 되면 이 게임의 본질 자체가 이상해지니 까지는 않겠다. 
(하지만 설명은 하겠다. 위의 공식 스샷을 보면 이해가 빠를 것이다.
기본적으로 캐릭터가 가운데에 위치하며, 
상하좌우의 키를 눌렀을 때만 그 칸에 이동해있고, 
사각형의 꼭짓점에 멈춰있으려면 2개의 버튼을 눌러주어야 한다. 
예로 캐릭터를 9개의 점 중 왼쪽 위의 좌표에 위치시킬려면 
상하좌우 키중 왼쪽 키와 위쪽 키를 동시에 누르고 있어야 한다는 뜻이다.)

평점

6 / 10

-단조롭고 피로해지는 그래픽
-장애물이 요구하는 높은 반응속도
-싫증나고 흥겹지 못한 bgm
-익숙해지지 않는 조작 방법
-새롭고 각 맵마다 각각 다른 개성 또는 특색이 있다고 느끼지 못하는 장애물의 패턴들
    (모든 맵의 패턴이 다 거기에서 거기다. 헥사곤 풍으로 가려던 것이 해를 준 듯하다. 
    다른 아이디어 한두개만 더 넣었어도 좀 더 좋았을 것 같은데...)

±게임플레이 화면 외의 (메인메뉴, 게임오버메뉴 등)투박한 메뉴 구성과 디자인들
    (게임하는데 있어서 별로 큰 영향은 없기 때문. 동기부여에 약간 해가 될 수도.)
±기록 랭킹 시스템(써보지 않았으므로)

+슈퍼헥사곤풍의 플레이어의 새로운 느낌의 움직임 그리고 새로운 느낌의 장애물


새로운 느낌의 게임을 찾고 있다면 구매해도 좋다. 
그러나 헥사곤만큼 기대하지는 말자. 
그리고 쓰다 보니 너무 부정적인 글이 되어버렸는데, 
혹시 이 게임을 즐겁게 하신 분이 둘러보다가 너무 짜증내지 않으셨으면 좋겠다. 
그저 주관적인 생각일 뿐이니 말이다. 내 취향이 좀 지나치게 밝은 쪽이기도 하고.

(심하게 부정적이고 긴, '그저' 주관적인 생각일 뿐이니 말이다.)

18486134.developer_response:
Thank you for the review. I can finally address this:

I like to think the fun of this game lies in the player's progression. Everyone starts out bad, but slowly grows into an awesome player. That being said, this game is certainly not made for everyone.

If you can't enjoy the progression, I completely respect your decision to not play the game. I just hope you can still see the value this game holds for other gamers.

Also, if you haven't already, I would return the game (Steam apparently does that now!).

Best,
-wes

This game is one of the most addictive and infuriating games i have ever had the (mis)fortune. Everything from the sound track to the visual style (Which is simple but effective) draws you in (Although the brightness of the colours can be a bit overbearing at times). Overall From the ammount of the game i have played so far, i am enjoying it. The frustration, the urge to better myself and gain better times will keep me coming back to this game.

the controls are simple, the ability to turn on an Epliepsy friendly mode is a great feature for this title (Due to some of the graphics present). And the ability to increase and decrease the curve of the screan is also a nice featuer (I personally dislike the curve of the screen but others may like it).

Overall, i personally feel it is a good game to play if you want to kill some time, it does hurt your eyes slightly due to the brightness of some of the colours but i personally dont feel that it should deter people from purchasing and playing this game.

17754533.review:
Adrenalitic. Hard. Addictive. Satisfying.
This is how I would describe this amazing game. Simply genious, as the idea behind it is very basic and simple, but the entertainment that it has to offer is unlimited.

The game is very hard, but so rewarding. Also the adrenaline that this game gives is unbeliavable, dodging incoming obstacles has never been so fun and never gives the anxiety that this game gives.

Controls are simple, you can move with WASD and all you have to do is dodging rectangles, trying to stay in the game as long as possible, that is not easy and simple as it sounds. 

RFLEX also is immediate and very quick to move from a scene to another. There are different difficulties that you can choose from and the last red one, Dead-Wish is simply impossible, but absolutely lovable and addictive as you want to carry on and beat it, resist always more and more time. Great the musics as well.

Simply genious is as I would describe it. Go for it, this will be your drug from now on. 
The only thing I wish this game could improve is getting on mobiles as I would like to have it always with me.

Videogame News, Indie Score: 9 | SUPER RECOMMENDED

17749527.review: Excellent casual game to quickly play in the bits of free time (and when procrastinating of course). The music selection is on point as it matches the speed of gameplay as well as style. Overall I highly recommend this!

17747370.review:
RFLEX at first glance looks like a simple game (in some ways it's like frogger, you have to dodge oncoming traffic) but eventually you'll come to realise it's tough. If you're a fan of super hard games like Super Hexagon you'll definitely enjoy the challenge but for some it might not be your cup of tea (sadly wasn't mine).

You have 5 different levels (+5 Drunk level modes) and each one is more challenging than the last, timing is crucial as one slip up can result in having to start the level again. All you have to do to pass a level is let your little pentagon survive for 60 seconds, which may or may not be easy depending on your reaction speed.

The sound design and music is fantastic though and is probably one of the high points I found in the game, if you can get the soundtrack I would recommend it.

Is the game worth the price? I'd say yes, despite the fact I wasn't any good at it doesn't mean everyone is going to be as bad as me.

In future I'd like to see more levels added or different challenges though!

17735940.review:
Only played this for a short time but it's not the type of game you need to pile in hours of gameplay to conclude an accurate opinion.

https://youtu.be/s6r2sb9vmqk

This is so similar to Super Hexagon I actually had to check to see if it was made by the same team!  If twitch reflex is what you're after then RFLEX is an excellent choice.  

Chasing the high-scores is incredibly challenging and motivating.  When you fail (which you will do, many, many times!) a restart takes miliseconds.  It's super easy to have 50x plays on this game in no time at all!  

My initial review outlined a couple of bugs with the game which weren't game-breaking but were annoyances.  The Dev was extremely proactive and resolved both these issues within hours.  Good stuff!!

Without doubt, if you enjoy Super Hexagon you will love this.  It has a good variety of game modes, the music is cool and I can see it starting a lot of inter-friend rivalry chasing each others leaderboard times!

By the way, it looks really easy... but it's not!!

17731781.review: Frustratingly simple mechanic. Recommended for fans of Super Hexagon, Geometry Dash, and the like.

17729338.review: I was given the pleasure of being able to play this game off and on throughout its development. I highly recommend it if you want a quick-fix actiony sort of game that you can pickup and play for 5-10 minutes when you need to blow off some steam. Well polished, great music, why haven't you bought this yet??

17729166.review:
[i]A key was provided to me by the developers, for review purposes. Thank you to them for that.[/i]

While [i]RFLEX[/i] reminds me alot of the Ludum Dare winner [i]Dodge[/i], it is much more polished and there is significantly more content. The menu layout, styling, and difficulty levels are very similiar to [i]Super Hexagon[/i]. Basically, you use either a keyboard or gamepad to move the polygon around a 3x3 grid to dodge incoming obstacles. Its hard as nails. There are several difficulties and several 'modes' (i.e. 'drunk mode' has altered controls and a visual filter). Leaderboards really give this something more than just trying to best your own score.

[b]Pros:[/b]
+Great music
+Overall, this takes a very simple game mechanic and makes an endless runner out of it
+Great minimalistic design
+There is real attention to detail with menus and stats (I especially like the progress bar during the run)
+Its cheap

[b]Cons:[/b]
-Although it is similiar in many ways, it is not as addictive to the legendary [i]Super Hexagon[/i]
-I think the background 'space' is a bit underused - it could take some notes from how [i]Sentris[/i] deals with background design (they could even be unlockables, which would further extend play)
[strike]-I could not find an options menu (mainly I wanted full screen mode)[/strike] EDIT: there is an options menu with fullscreen mode, I just missed it. See first comment below to find it if you are having trouble.
-I love the ideas of different modes (e.g. 'drunk mode'), but I had little interest in playing with modified controls (it is hard enough without them ;) )

[b]Is this title going to redefine a genre? No. Will this be enjoyable by those who play games like [i]Super Hexagon[/i] and [i]Boson X[/i]? Sure.[/b]

17726955.review:
Wonderful game. Especially to those who enjoy hard, challenging games like Super Hexagon.
The game features 5 different unique levels that all have their own challenging patterns.
There's also a drunk mode, what basically inverts your movement direction for those who want an extra challenge,

Be sure to give it a look!
